intro: Achnophora, commonly known as the stinging nettle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Urticaceae. These plants are characterized by their hollow, hairless stems and leaves with stinging hairs that cause a skin irritation when touched. Achnophora species are typically herbaceous and can be found in temperate regions around the world. They often grow in moist, disturbed soils and are known for their ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Some species of Achnophora are used in traditional medicine and as a food source for certain animals.
